title: Preview pane changed from session content to analytics - would like option to toggle back
body:
After updating to fix the freeze issues in #39, I noticed the preview pane now shows token/cost analytics instead of the actual session content.

**What I used to see:**
The preview pane showed the last few lines of the session output, which was really helpful for quickly scanning sessions to remember what each one was doing.

**What I see now:**
Session Analytics with token counts, duration, and cost estimates.

**What would be ideal:**
Either:
1. Option to toggle between content preview and analytics view (like a keyboard shortcut)
2. Config option to choose which preview mode to use by default
3. Show content preview by default, with analytics available somewhere else (maybe on demand?)

**Why this matters:**
When I have multiple sessions running, the content preview helps me quickly identify:
- What task each session is working on
- Whether it's paused/waiting for input
- If there were any recent errors
- General context at a glance

The analytics are great for tracking usage, but the content preview was more useful for day-to-day session management.

**Environment:**
- agent-deck v0.8.32
- macOS (Darwin 24.6.0)
